p: The majority of case studies focused on the establishment and spread phases of biological invasions only (cf. Blackburn et al., 2011), while the transport and introduction phases are often neglected even in areas where the species is not present yet. Only a few papers focused on other metrics for invasion risk, for example, changes in abundance ( N = 5), growth ( N = 1), or changes in the number of generations ( N = 3) in areas.
